data.summary: [PR Newswire] - DETROIT, Jan. 12, 2017 /PRNewswire/ -- Adient (ADNT), the world's largest global automotive seating supplier, today announced that its RECARO Automotive Seating product group has won a significant contract with MAN Truck & Bus AG to increase annual seat production at the company's facility in Skarbimierz, Poland. Starting in 2020, RECARO Automotive Seating will incrementally begin supplying high quality commercial vehicle seats for the entire range of MAN models TGL, TGM, TGS and TGX. "We are exceedingly pleased by the trust that MAN Truck & Bus has put in RECARO Automotive Seating by placing this order," said Dr. David Herberg, executive director commercial vehicle seating.
data.title: RECARO Automotive Seating wins major award with MAN Truck & Bus AG

data.summary: [PR Newswire] - PLYMOUTH, Mich., Jan. 10, 2017 /PRNewswire/ -- Adient (ADNT), a global leader in automotive seating and interiors, will hold an investor call on February 3, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. (ET) to discuss its first quarter fiscal 2017 financial results. A link to the live webcast of the call and presentation materials will be available on the Adient Investor Relations website. The conference passcode is ADIENT.
data.title: Adient to discuss Q1 fiscal 2017 financial results on February 3, 2017

data.summary: [PR Newswire] - DETROIT, Jan. 3, 2017 /PRNewswire/ -- Adient (ADNT), the world's largest global automotive seating supplier, has collaborated with FCA US LLC to produce a vision of the future of seating for the automaker's Chrysler Portal concept vehicle. The Chrysler Portal is a forward-thinking interpretation of the "fifth generation" of family transportation targeted at the millennial generation.The vehicle was unveiled today by FCA US at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas. The seat will be displayed at Adient's booth at the 2017 North American International Auto Show (NAIAS) in Detroit's Cobo Center next week.
data.title: Adient collaborates with FCA US on future seating vision for its Chrysler Portal concept vehicle

data.summary: [PR Newswire] - PLYMOUTH, Mich., Dec. 6, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- Today Adient, the world's largest global automotive seating supplier, made an Ypsilanti Township family new homeowners. The company's employee volunteers renovated a home through Habitat for Humanity of Huron Valley for Christina Thomas and her family. "I realize none of this would have been possible without the generous donation from my sponsor, Adient," said Thomas.

data.summary: [PR Newswire] - DETROIT, Nov. 30, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- Adient (ADNT), the world's largest global automotive seating supplier, today announced the company has acquired the 10-story, 164,000-square-foot Marquette Building located at 243 West Congress in Detroit's historic financial district, across from Cobo Center. The company will invest approximately $50 million into renovating the building to establish its global headquarters and bring roughly 500 jobs to the city of Detroit, of which approximately 100 will be newly created. Adient will work with the city to fill as many of those jobs as possible with Detroit residents.
data.title: Adient announces plans to establish Detroit global headquarters bringing 500 jobs to the city

data.summary: [PR Newswire] - PLYMOUTH, Mich., Nov. 14, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- Adient, the world's largest global automotive seating supplier, today announced the opening of its West Coast business office in San Jose, Calif. The office will serve as a research and development hub supporting existing OEM customers and new players to the automotive industry focused on connected and autonomous vehicles. "Our entry into the West Coast is strategic and significant," said McDonald.
data.title: Global seat supplier Adient opens West Coast office

data.summary: [PR Newswire] - NEW YORK, Oct. 31, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- Adient (NYSE:ADNT) announced its debut as an independent, publicly traded corporation and the completion of its separation from Johnson Controls International. Adient is the world's largest global automotive seating suppliers, supporting all major automakers in differentiating vehicles through superior quality, technology and performance. The distribution of Adient ordinary shares took place at 12:01 a.m. ET on October 31, 2016. Adient issued one ordinary share for every ten Johnson Controls shares held on October 19, 2016, the record date for the distribution.
data.title: Adient completes separation from Johnson Controls International; begins trading today on NYSE

data.summary: [PR Newswire] - PLYMOUTH, Mich., Oct. 25, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- Adient (NYSE: ADNT), a global leader in automotive seating and interiors, will hold an investor call on November 8, 2016 at 2:00 p.m. (ET) to discuss its fourth quarter fiscal 2016 financial results. Adient is currently comprised of the automotive seating and interiors business of Johnson Controls International plc and is expected to become an independent, publicly traded company on October 31, 2016. A link to the live webcast of the call and presentation materials will be available on the Adient Investor Relations website.
data.title: Adient to discuss Q4 fiscal 2016 financial results on November 8, 2016
